item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Source: Eli Manning, New York Giants agree to six-year, $97.5 million contract extension
item.description: Eli Manning has agreed to a new six-year, $97 million contract extension with the New York Giants that will make him the highest-paid player in the NFL with an average salary of roughly $15.3 million.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Atlanta Falcons receiver Harry Douglas out for season with knee injury
item.description: Atlanta Falcons receiver Harry Douglas is out for the season after suffering a knee injury.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: With targets on backs, Florida Gators begin fall practice
item.description: Defending national champion Florida opened fall practice Thursday with hopes of winning a third title in four years.

item.dc:creator: Chad Ford
item.title: Brandon Roy, Portland Trail Blazers agree to 5-year extension
item.description: The Portland Trail Blazers have reached an agreement on a five-year contract extension with guard Brandon Roy a league source told ESPN.com.

item.dc:creator: External
item.title: In progress: Mickelson on course at Bridgestone
item.description: In-progress scores from the first round of the Bridgestone Invitational in Akron, Ohio.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Report: Steve McNair to be honored by Tennessee Titans with No. 9 helmet decal
item.description: The Tennesee Titans will reportedly honor late quarterback Steve McNair with a No. 9 decal they will wear on the backs of their helmets this season.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Lou Holtz has no intention of running for Congress
item.description: Former Notre Dame football coach Lou Holtz tells an Indiana television station he doesn't plan to run for Congress.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Tennis federation appeals Richard Gasquet doping ruling
item.description: The International Tennis Federation says it has appealed a ruling that cleared tennis player Richard Gasquet of doping.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Topps reaches multiyear licensing deal with Major League Baseball
item.description: Topps has reached a deal with Major League Baseball to become its first official baseball card company in almost 30 years.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Pedro Martinez strikes out 11 in Double-A rehab start
item.description: Pedro Martinez recorded nine of his first 12 outs by strikeout and worked six innings for the Double-A Reading on Wednesday night, in what could have been his final rehab start before joining the Philadelphia Phillies.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Dodgers tighten security after Prince Fielder's tirade
item.description: While Prince Fielder took batting practice at Dodger Stadium before Wednesday night's game, no fewer than nine stern-faced members of the ballpark's security staff maintained a vigilant presence outside the Milwaukee Brewers' clubhouse.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Report: Kurt Rambis emerges as Minnesota Timberwolves top candidate
item.description: Kurt Rambis reportedly went to Minnesota and could be named the team's next head coach.
